title: Easy Steps to Create a Add Drop Caps in Microsoft Word

steps.title: Select the first letter of a paragraph.
steps.content: Select the first letter of a paragraph. You must select existing text to be able to use the Drop Cap menu, if you have space selected, the option will be greyed out in your menu. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Go to Insert.
steps.content: Go to Insert . It's in the editing ribbon next to File and Home . [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Drop Cap.
steps.content: Click Drop Cap . You'll find this in the "Text" grouping of the menu and more options will drop down. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you don't see this option, click the icon in the "Text" panel that has an A with several lines.

steps.title: Select an option.
steps.content: Select an option. If you want to keep the drop cap aligned with your text and in your paragraph, select Dropped . If you want to add your drop cap to the outside of your text, select In margin . [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To remove the drop cap, select the text then go to Insert > Drop Cap > None .

steps.title: Customize the drop cap (if you don't like the default).
steps.content: Customize the drop cap (if you don't like the default). Highlight your drop cap, then go to Insert > Drop Cap > Drop Cap Options . You'll have some options to customize your drop cap: [5] X Research source Font lets you change the font, which will only apply to your drop cap not the rest of your text. The option of Lines to drop will change how big your drop cap appears. Distance from text allows you to change how far away your drop cap is from your text. Click OK when you're done to save your changes to your drop cap.

steps.title: Make sure you're in "Print Layout" view.
steps.content: Make sure you're in "Print Layout" view. It's the default view mode, but if it isn't active, you won't see the drop cap menus. If you're not sure if you're in "Print Layout," go to View and click Print Layout . [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Drop Cap.
steps.content: Click Drop Cap . You'll find this in the "Format" menu that appears next to your cursor.

steps.title: Select an option for the drop cap.
steps.content: Select an option for the drop cap. If you want to keep the drop cap aligned with your text and in your paragraph, select Dropped . If you want to add your drop cap to the outside of your text, select In margin . [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft.
